channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tip, 12th October
item.description:
Fly tip in graveyard. I have reported this three times. The latest reply from you is thst yoy do not own the church. Today 12/10/2025. I visited the church where a service was being held. I spoke to one of the officials who assures me that while the church is privately owned the graveyard is maintained by the London Borough of Bromley. As you can see by the photos I have provided your leisure services have signs on the gates. Please tidy this up a.s.a.p. thankyou

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of potholes on Junction Rd bus lane SB, 12th October
item.description:
There are lots of potholes, some having been patched over making the road very uneven. I've gotten a flat tire from these before, so they're potentially dangerous and getting worse. Resurfacing the street or at least evening out the surface would help greatly. This concerns the entire stretch southbound from Monnery Rd until a bit after the rail bridge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Junction Road, Archway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: In front of The Fields Beneath, 12th October
item.description:
There's an abandoned bike locked to the bike stand closest to the station entrance (been there for over two months) and two abandoned bikes at the stands in front of the café, having been there for 6+ months. I confirmed with café staff that they're abandoned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Prince of Wales Road, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load (Estates)

item.title: Gate stuck, 12th October
item.description:
The small gate (the only one not padlocked) has a latch that doesn't open properly. I had to rescue someone on a mobility scooter from the park as they had no way of getting out there. The latch doesn't lift to open the gate so had to lift the entire gate on its hinges just to free the latch. Without help that disabled man wouldn't have been able to get out of the gate.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westmoreland Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken bottles/glass across footpath, 12th October
item.description:
Someone has deliberately broken a number of drinks bottles and strewn broken glass right across the footpath (see ringed blue area in attached photo). This caused a punctured tyre on my bike two weeks ago and is still there. Will be dangerous for dogs' paws and small children.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bazalgette Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen trees across waterway, 12th October
item.description:
Fallen trees from high winds over three weeks ago across waterway adjacent to footbridge at location pointed to on map. This happened some months ago at same location. Can a tree surgeon or similar RBG council/Peabody staff member walk around waterway and 'thin out' very dense trees and bushes for example along Foxglove Path.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newacres Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More rubbish, 12th October
item.description:
Why are these raised beds not cleared? Why do you report that the issue has been resolved when it’s not? Constant dumping of rubbish, broken bottles, bags of dog mess dumped daily! This needs to be sorted out. Broken bottles and glass on the grass areas.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The entirity of Green Lane has no street lights, 12th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Parkview Road, New Eltham, London

item.title: Litter and Bags of Leaves on Dunsmure for Weeks, 12th October
item.description:
South Dunsmure Road is strewn with litter and has been for weeks. There have also been bags of leaves left in recycling bins on the pavement, which have been there for weeks, & discarded broom handles. Can Hackney please clean the street thoroughly weekly?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunsmure Road, Hackney, London
